channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ID
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ID

item.title: Report X-2023110276
item.description:
Report X-2023110276

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: BOISE
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER FOUND LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE TRAILER HE WAS UNLOADING; HE LEFT THE TRAILER AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR OF THE LEAKER WHO CALLED OVER THE RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER ARRIVED AT THE SPILLAGE AREA AND CONTAINED THE SPIL AND BROUGHT TO THE DMP.

item.title: Report E-2023110225
item.description:
Report E-2023110225

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: MCCAMMON
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit the driver stopped for a break and performed a load check and noticed a dark orangish liquid dripping for his trailer around 0930. The driver then put down some absorbent pads and a bucket to help mitigate the release. He then called in to report the release. We then dispatched a team to go out to the seen and start the clean up process. The team arrived on seen at approximately 1500 and dawned the proper PPE and began the clean up procedure. The drum had a small pinhole above the top chime that looks like it may have been rubbing against another container or pallet during transit. The drum was overpacked and all absorbent material was disposed of and transported for disposal per proper regulation.

item.title: Report E-2023110045
item.description:
Report E-2023110045

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: MERIDIAN
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 5 gallons spilled from a bucket of the product onto a trailer. The cause of the damage is unknown. A Contractor was called to assist with the cleanup of material. It seems the cause of the spill would be improper packaging.
